intro: Tribulus megistopterus subsp. pterocarpus, commonly known as the Indian goji or Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, inflated fruits. Its botanical features include spiny stipules and a unique fruit structure that splits open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
